rules: Rule1: If alcohol was prescribed for patient1, then patient1 is stable.

Rule2: Provided that patient1 was admitted to the facility, if a counselor was assigned to patient1, then whenever withdrawal was monitored in patient1, it follows that if therapy was provided to patient1, then patient1 requires treatment.
Rule3: Patient1 completed the program or patient1 left against advice.
Rule4: Whenever patient1 left against advice, patient1 is stable.
Rule5: If patient1 was stabilized, then should patient1 complete the program, patient1 is discharged.
Rule6: Patient1 relapsed or if patient1 responded to treatment, then patient1 was stabilized.
Rule7: Whenever patient1 maintained sobriety, it is not the case that patient1 relapsed.
Rule8: Should patient1 attend a session, patient1 was engaged.
Rule9: Either patient1 attended a session or patient1 missed a session.
Rule10: If patient1 missed a session, then patient1 is stable.
Rule11: Whenever a drug was prescribed for patient1, patient1 is stable.
Rule12: Provided that patient1 participated, patient1 is stable.
Rule13: Should patient1 be engaged, patient1 was cooperative.
Rule14: Whenever participation was encouraged for patient1, if patient1 was engaged, then patient1 participated.
Rule15: If behavior was praised for patient1, then either calm behavior was exhibited by patient1 or a violent episode did not occur with patient1.
Rule16: Under the condition that behavior was corrected for patient1, either calm behavior was exhibited by patient1 or a violent episode did not occur with patient1.
Rule17: If progress was documented for patient1, then either behavior was praised for patient1 or behavior was corrected for patient1.
Rule18: Provided that regression was noted for patient1, either behavior was praised for patient1 or behavior was corrected for patient1.
Rule19: Whenever the chart was reviewed by doctor1, progress was documented for patient1.
Rule20: Should the chart be updated by doctor1, regression was noted for patient1.
Rule21: Under the condition that the case was discussed by the team, either the chart was reviewed by doctor1 or the chart was updated by doctor1.
Rule22: Either the case was discussed by the team or a specialist was consulted by the team.
Rule23: Whenever a specialist was consulted by the team, either the chart was reviewed by doctor1 or the chart was updated by doctor1.
Rule24: If crisis intervention occurred for patient1, then an emergency situation did not occur with patient1.
Rule25: Provided that conflicting reports were present for patient1, patient1 had a positive outlook.
Rule26: Should conflicting reports be present for patient1, patient1 had a negative outlook.
Rule27: Whenever patient1 had a negative outlook, patient1 did not have a positive outlook.
Rule28: If patient1 requires treatment, then whenever abuse was detected in patient1, either alcohol was prescribed for patient1 or a drug was prescribed for patient1.
Rule29: Either discharge was approved for patient1 or discharge was denied for patient1.
Rule30: Should discharge be denied for patient1, patient1 is stable.
Rule31: If the story was inconsistent from patient1, then patient1 was deceptive.
Rule32: Under the condition that the story was inconsistent from patient1, patient1 was not truthful.
Rule33: Either the story was inconsistent from patient1 or if discharge was approved for patient1, then patient1 was discharged.
Rule34: Whenever patient1 was deceptive, patient1 was truthful.
Rule35: If readiness was evaluated for patient1, then provided that patient1 was cooperative, patient1 participated.
Rule36: Whenever the protocol was clear, conflicting reports were not present for patient1.
Rule37: Under the condition that the procedure was followed by the staff, the protocol was clear.
Rule38: Either the procedure was followed by the staff or the procedure was deviated from by the staff.
Rule39: If medication was administered to patient1, then patient1 requires treatment.
Rule40: Medication was administered to patient1 or therapy was provided to patient1.
Rule41: Whenever the deviation was justified by the staff, the protocol was clear.
Rule42: If the incident was reported by the staff, then a report was filed by the staff.
Rule43: Either the incident was reported by the staff or if the procedure was deviated from by the staff, then the deviation was justified by the staff.
Rule44: Under the condition that a report was filed by the staff, the incident was overlooked by the staff.
Rule45: If a violation was identified by the staff, then the incident was not overlooked by the staff.
Rule46: Either a violation was identified by the staff or a violation was ignored by the staff.
Rule47: Whenever a violation was ignored by the staff, the incident was not overlooked by the staff.
Rule48: Provided that the alarm was triggered by patient1, crisis intervention occurred for patient1.
Rule49: Should the response be activated by the team, the alarm was triggered by patient1.
Rule50: If the protocol was initiated by the staff, then whenever patient1 is not stable, the response was activated by the team.
Rule51: Whenever the plan was executed by the staff, the protocol was initiated by the staff.
Rule52: If the intervention was successful by the staff, then the plan was executed by the staff.
Rule53: Either the intervention was successful by the staff or the intervention failed by the staff.
Rule54: Should the outcome be assessed by the staff, if the intervention failed by the staff, then the plan was executed by the staff.
Rule55: If the issue was resolved by the staff, then the situation did not have confusion.
Rule56: Either the issue was resolved by the staff or the issue was escalated by the staff.
Rule57: Under the condition that the issue was escalated by the staff, the situation did not have confusion.
Rule58: The situation had panic or if patient1 is not stable, then an emergency situation did not occur with patient1.
Rule59: Either the response was calm by the staff or the response was agitated by the staff.
Rule60: Should the response be agitated by the staff, the situation did not have panic.
Rule61: Provided that the effort was coordinated by the staff, if the response was calm by the staff, then the situation was under control.
Rule62: Either a counselor was assigned to patient1 or a support group was assigned to patient1.
Rule63: Whenever a support group was assigned to patient1, if withdrawal was monitored in patient1, then provided that therapy was provided to patient1, patient1 requires treatment.
Rule64: If it is not the case that a routine check was performed on patient1 or if patient1 is not stable, then crisis intervention occurred for patient1, then a false alarm occurred for patient1.
Rule65: Provided that it is not the case that the response was chaotic by the staff or the effort was coordinated by the staff, then the situation was contained.
Rule66: If it is not the case that the response was chaotic by the staff or the effort was coordinated by the staff, then the situation was not contained.

Rule67: Under the condition that it is not the case that it is not the case that a routine check was performed on patient1 or if patient1 is not stable, then crisis intervention occurred for patient1 implies a false alarm did not occur for patient1, then conflicting reports were present for patient1.

Rule68: Whenever it is not the case that it is not the case that a routine check was performed on patient1 or if patient1 is not stable, then crisis intervention occurred for patient1 implies a false alarm did not occur for patient1, then the situation had confusion.
Rule69: If readiness was not evaluated for patient1, then readiness was misjudged for patient1.
Rule70: Should readiness not be evaluated for patient1, then readiness was not misjudged for patient1.
Rule71: Provided that patient1 is not stable, a violent episode occurred with patient1.
Rule72: Under the condition that patient1 is not stable, an emergency situation occurred with patient1.
facts: Fact1: Patient1 was admitted to the facility.
Fact4: Participation was encouraged for patient1.
Fact5: Abuse was detected in patient1.
Fact6: The outcome was assessed by the staff.
Fact7: Withdrawal was monitored in patient1.
Fact9: Calm behavior was not exhibited by patient1.
Fact10: A routine check was not performed on patient1.
Fact11: The situation was not under control.
Fact12: The response was not chaotic by the staff.
